main event: A couple observed a bright yellow flash and subsequent explosions in the sky while looking out their window in Dayton, Ohio, on December 4, 1958.
interesting points: The observation started with a bright yellow flash thought to be lightning, followed by a muffled sound perceived as an explosion., The husband noted seeing an explosion in the west as the wife described a glowing orange-yellow sphere., The object appeared to hover and oscillate before disappearing upwards at high speed., The sightings included multiple flashings that increased in intensity and brilliance during the event., No electrical disturbances were reported by local power companies, and the witnesses ruled out natural explanations.
witness description: a husband and wife who witnessed the event from their home
